title: Financial Assistance to SC students studying in Adarsh Nivasi Shala (Upgradation) (BCK-	2B)

details.Scheme Name: Financial Assistance to SC students studying in Adarsh Nivasi Shala(Upgradation) (BCK-	2B).
details.Eligibility Criteria :: The student should be of Scheduled Caste., The student should be studying in an ideal residential school., Meritorious  students will be selected according to the set target., No Income Limit.
details.Assistance Details:
Extra Training given to SC Students., Per student amount of Rs. 25000/- is spent as per scheme. Which	include hostel expense Rs. 9000/-, Pocket Money Rs. 3000/- , Books	& Stationary Rs. 3000/-, and Honorarium to Principal-Expert
Rs. 10,000/-.
Note: As lodging & Boarding are provided free in an ideal residential school Rs.9,000 / -is not paid to students.
details.Pre-defined Application Form: The scheme is implemented from the concerned Adarsh Niwasi	School.
details.Implementing Office: District Deputy Director (SCW) Office & Concerned Adarsh Niwasi	School.

title: Financial Assistance to SC Bright Students studying in Selected Schools (BCK-3)

details.Scheme Name: Financial Assistance to SC Bright Students studying in Selected Schools (BCK-3).
details.Eligibility Criteria ::
The student should be of Scheduled Caste., Students should be studying in Selected schools., The student's family income should not be more than ten times the income fixed for the poverty line.
(For Urban area: 6,00,000/-, For Rural Area:6,00,000/-)., Students should be studying in Selected schoolsStudents studying in Std-9 or Std-11 will be eligible for assistance only once., For Balachadi School-Jamnagar, Sainik School-Kherva assistance can be given in Std:6 also.
details.Assistance Details: Extra Training given to SC StudentsFor Balachadi School-Jamnagar, Sainik School-Kherva assistance can be given in Std:6 also.
details.Pre-defined Application Form: District Deputy Director(SCW) Office and Director, Scheduled Caste Welfare Office.

details.Eligibility Criteria :: Only Scheduled Caste Girls Students are eligible., For Diploma level courses, In Std: 10 or 12 should have 50% or more percentile in the examination., For Graduate level courses, In Std: 12 should have 50% or more percentile in the examination., Must full fill all conditions of Government of India's Post Matric Scholarship Scheme Guidelines., Income Limit: More than 2.50 Lakh.
details.Scholarship Rate:: The following group wise Academic Allowance admissible
details.Online Portal:: In addition to the above allowance, Approved tuition fee and Approved  other fees are admissible, If the student is disabled then disability allowance is admissible.

title: Loan assistance to Scheduled Caste students for pilot training.

details.Objective :: To get the Scheduled Caste students trained and prepare as Pilots.
details.Eligibility criteria:: No income limit., SSC pass or more.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Rs. 25 lakhs as loan at the rate of interest at 4% p.a.
details.Conditions:: Loan repayment commences after one year from the date of disbursement of the loan amount., Loan is to be repaid within 10 years by equal monthly installments and if so desired by the candidate, in quarterly installments with prior intimation., After repayment of entire loan amount, the interest payable thereon shall also be paid in the same fashion., Penal interest at the rate of 2.5% shall be charged on default of repayment of loan regularly., In case of default in repayment of installments including penal interest, all overdue amounts recoverable with other expenses shall be recovered through Revenue Recovery procedure.

title: Dr.Baba Saheb Ambedkar Loan for higher study in foreign countries.

details.Eligibility Criteria:: No income limit., To be granted to Scheduled Caste students intending to prosecute higher studies in foreign countries., Should have obtained Visa., For Diploma and equivalent technical and professional and technical courses after obtaining 50% in Std.XII examination., For post-graduate courses, sanction is being granted after obtaining 50% marks in Graduation level examinations., Application is to be submitted before leaving abroad.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Loan assistance for Rs. 15 lakhs with 4% interest rate.

title: Uniform Assistance to SC Students

details.Eligibility Criteria :: Student should be of Scheduled Caste., Student should be studying in class 1 to 8., No Income Limit.
details.Assistance Details: Rs.900/- assistance for three pairs of uniforms.

title: Specialscholarship to Most backwardCaste Students amongst SC(Vandaniy SantShriVasiyadada Scholarship

details.Eligibility criteria :: Student should belong to the most backward castes among the scheduled castes., No Income Limit.
details.Assistance Details::
Online Work have to be done through school principals
(Portal: https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in).

title: Subedar Ramji Ambedkar Scheme of GIA for hostels.

details.Grant to hostels run by voluntary organi: At present there are 425 boys and 167 girls hostels, in all, 592 hostels are running., 13152 boys and 5722 girls accommodated (Total 18,874), Annual maintenance of one hostel – Rs.1,99,600/-
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Maintenance grant @ Rs. 1500/- per month per inmate (for 10 months), Grant on pay of Grihpati (Hostel keeper) – Rs. 5500/- to Rs. 6500/-., Rs. 50/- per inmate for Panchayat areas (towards building rent), Rs. 70/- per inmate for Municipal area and Rs. 90/- for Municipal Corporation area., Rs. 3000/- for watchman (towards salary), Rs. 3500/- to cook (towards salary), Rs. 3000/- to Assistant Cook (towards salary)., Grant is paid for electrification, sports equipments, library books, newspapers, periodicals etc., The organization which runs three or more such hostels, are being paid 5% administrative grant on the expenditure incurred on approved items.

title: GIA for building construction for Boys Hostels for backward class.

details.Eligibility criteria :: As per the rules amended by the State Government, grant of Rs.4.00 lakhs paid only on new constructions.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: For construction of Scheduled caste boys hostel, grant is paid as assistance at the rate of 75% of the total expenditure as per the S.O.R. so prescribed by the State Government for respective year OR Rs.4.00 lakhs, whichever is less.

title: GIA for building construction for Girls Hostels for backward class.

details.Eligibility criteria:: For construction of Scheduled caste Girls hostel, grant is paid as assistance at the rate of 90% of the total expenditure/cost as per the S.O.R. so prescribed by the State Government for respective year OR Rs.4.00 lakhs, whichever is less.

title: Additional coaching centers in Grant-in-aid and government hostels.

details.Objective:: Coaching classes are run for the Hosteller Students of Std.8 to 10 for extract coaching in important subjects like Mathematics, Science and English.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Rs.300/- per subject is paid for classes of Std.8 to 10, for 9 months.

title: BCK-24 Establishment and development of Government Hostels for Boys and Girls

details.Eligibility Criteria:: Income limit for admission to the Boys Hostel is Rs.1,00,000/- per annum., No income limit for admission to Girls Hostel., 50% or more marks for Graduate levels., Admission is granted to the students of following courses with percentages so mentioned against each courses:-
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Free lodging and boarding facilities.

title: Construction of Government Hostels for Boys.

details.Objectives:: Provide structural facilities to upper-level students., Construction of houses for the hostels where the government hostels are run in the rental premises.., There are plans to build Kumar hostels in the following districts in the current state., Dholka, Dist. Ahmedabad, Nalya, Ta. Abdasa, district Kutch, Bayad, D-Arvalli, Iadar,D-Sabarkantha, Adipur, Kutch, Gariyadhar, Bhavnagar, Samras Kumar Hostel, Ahmedabad, Samras Kumar Hostel, Vadodara, Samras Kumar Hostel, Surat, Samras Kumar Hostel, Rajkot, Samras Kumar Hostel, Bhavnagar, Samras Kumar Hostel, Anand, Samras Kumar Hostel, Jamnagar, Samras Kumar Hostel, Bhuj, Samras Kumar Hostel, Himmatnagar, Samras Kumar Hostel, Patan, Narsinh Bhagat Hostel, Paldi, Ahmedabad

title: Renovation and modernization of Government buildings, hostels and Residential School etc.
Construction of Government Hostels for Girls.

details.Objectives:: Provide structural facilities to upper-level students., Vadhavan, Surendranagar, Ranip, Ahmedabad, Samras Girls Hostel, Ahmedabad, Samras Girls Hostel, Vadodara, Samras Girls Hostel, Surat, Samras Girls Hostel, Rajkot, Samras Girls Hostel, Bhavnagar, Samras Girls Hostel, Anand, Samras Girls Hostel, Jamnagar, Samras Girls Hostel, Bhuj, Samras Girls Hostel, Himmatnagar, Samras Girls Hostel, Patan, Adarsh Nivasi Shala(Girls), Rajkot
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Per student 3.17 lakh for construction..
details.Eligibility Criteria :: Construction of houses for hostels where the government hostels are running.

title: Shri Jugatram Dave Ashram Schools Scheme.

details.Pattern of Assistance:: Voluntary organizations recognized on grant-in-aid basis are sanctioned Ashram School with 30 students intake in the first year and thereafter gradual increase. The Ashram School becomes fully developed when strength of students reaches 120 numbers.

title: Mama Saheb Fadke Ideal Residential Schools for Scheduled Caste Scheme

details.Pattern of Assistance:: No income limit., Admission on merit basis to the students securing 50% marks in Std.8.

title: AwardPrice to SCstudents who secured top ranks at StateandDistrict levelinStd.10andStd.12

details.Eligibility criteria :: Student should belong to  scheduled castes., Student should be in Merit., No Income Limit.
details.Assistance Details:Assistance State Leve: District Deputy Director(SCW) Office and Director, Scheduled Caste Welfare Office.

title: Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Award, Mahatma Gandhi Award, Sant Shri Kabir Dalit Sahitya Award.

details.Eligibility Criteria:: Individual Award of Rs.2.00 lakh Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Award., Rs.2.00 Lakh Mahatma Gandhi Award for institute., Rs.1.00 Lakh Sant Shri Kabir Dalit Literate Award (Dalit litterateur), Rs.50,000/- Dasi Jivan Outstanding Dalit Literary Work (Dalit Litterateur), Rs.50,000/- Mahatma Phule Outstanding Dalit Journalist Award (Dalit Journalist), Financial Assistance up to Rs.10,000/- to Dalit Litterateur for publication., Rs.50,000/- Cash Award for recognition of contribution in Handicraft field (Dalit Mahila Art/Literature Award)
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Application Form for Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Award to the person/dignitary who has significantly contributed in social welfare work., Application Form for scheme of "Dasi Jivan Outstanding Dalit Literary Work Award” for the creative Dalit literary work for Schedule Caste., Application Form for Mahatma Gandhi Award to the institutions which have contributed remarkably in social welfare work., Application form for Scheme of "Sant Shri Kabir Dalit Sahitya Award”, Application form for Scheme of "Dalit Mahila Art/Literature Award”, Application form for scheme of "Mahatma Phule Outstanding Dalit Journalist Award” to the creative Dalit journalist of Schedule Cast.

title: Pre Matric Scholarship for student of   IX & X. (CSS)

details.Eligibility criteria :: Student should belong to  scheduled castes., Income limit: 2.50 Lakh.
details.Assistance Details::
Online Work have to be done through school principals
(Portal: https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in).

title: Training to SC Students for IIM,NIFT,CEPT etc Examination

details.Scheme Name: Coaching Assistance to SC s: Students should be of Scheduled Caste., A student should have secured 70% or more in class 10 and studying in class 12 (any stream) to get admission in  CEPT, NIFT,NLU., To get admission in IIMs: Must have secured 70% or more in class 12th (any stream) and be in third year of graduation (any stream) or should have secured 70% or more marks in graduation if completed graduation., No Income Limit.
details.Eligibility Criteria:: The organization should have more than three years of experience., The organization should have GST number / PAN card., Institutions should have biometric (fingerprint) machines for student attendance., The training institute should be registered under any one of the following Acts.

title: Talentpool Scheme for SC Students

details.Eligibility criteria :: Student should belong to  scheduled castes., Students should be studying in designated residential schools., Income Limit 6.00 Lakh (Parents whose income is between Rs.2.00 lakh and Rs.3.00 lakh are eligible for 50% assistance.).
details.Assistance Details:: Rs. 40,000/- or Actual whichever is less.

title: Training to SC Students fo GUJCAT, PMT,NEET & JEE  Examination

details.Scheme Name: BCK-354 Coaching Assistance: Students should be of Scheduled Caste., There is no income limit for students., Students for preparation of exams like NEET, JEE, GUJCET with 70% or more marks in Std. 10 and Must be studying in Std. 12 (Science stream).
details.Starting Year of the Scheme:2014-15: The organization should have more than three years of experience., The organization should have GST number / PAN card., Institutions should have biometric (fingerprint) machines for student attendance., Faculty for NEET, JEE who should have done M.Sc in that subject., The training institute should be registered under any one of the following Acts.

title: Tablet free of cost to students of scheduled caste 12 students

details.Eligibility criteria :: Student should belong to  scheduled castes., Students should have received a tablet with a token fee of Rs.1000 from the Education Department., No Income Limit.

title: Manav Garima Yojana

details.Eligibility Criteria:: Financial assistance for the Scheduled Caste persons desirous to start cottage industry for self-employing without obtaining bank loans., Income limit – Rs.47,000/- for rural areas and Rs.68,000/- for urban areas.
details.Patten of Assistance:: Financial Assistance  for equipment assistance., This Scheme is implemented D-01/04/2012 through Gujarat Scheduled Caste Development Corporation, Gandhinagar.

title: Dr. P. G. Financial Assistance Scheme for Solanki Lawyers – Stipend

details.Eligibility Criteria:: Period of experience for senior lawyer is 10 years., Can train maximum 2 (two) junior lawyers., No income limit., Application to be submitted within 2 years after registration with Bar Council.
details.Pattern of Assistance :: Rs.1,000/- p.m. for the first year to the Law Graduate., Rs.800/- p.m. during second year,, Rs.600/- p.m. during third year., Senior lawyer is paid Rs.500/- p.m. per trainee.

title: Dr.P.G.Solanki Financial Assistance to M.S./M.D. doctors to start surgical nursing home/ d

details.Pattern of Assistance :: Loan up to 25% of the bank loan but limited to Rs.3,00,000/- for establishing clinic and nursing home, and subsidy of Rs.50,000/-., Rate of interest – 4%

title: Dr.P.G.Solanki Loan Assistances to Law Graduates.
Loan assistance scheme for MBBS, BHAM, BAAMS, BDS (Dental) and Homeopathic Doctor to start an indepe

details.Objective:: This scheme is launched with a view to help Scheduled Caste doctors to start their independent profession.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Subsidy for Rs.25,000/-, Loan upto Rs.2.50 lakhs., Loan is advanced at 4% rate of interest.

title: Tailoring Centre for women.

details.Eligibility Criteria:: No income limit (2 tailoring classes are functional)
details.Pattern of assistance:: Stipend of Rs.250/- per month and subsidy of Rs.1500/- to purchase a stitching machine by the trained women.

title: Setting up and running of Training cum production centre.

details.Eligibility Criteria:: These training centers are run by the Department of Cottage Industries.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Training in trades such as Turning, Fitting, Welding, Motor Mechanic, Carpentry, blacksmith etc. is imparted in such centers.  Stipend of Rs.125/- per month is paid to trainees.

title: Financial Assistance for Pre-examination Training Centre and allied professions to the Sche

details.Scheme Name: SCW-11 Coaching Assistance: Students should be of Scheduled Caste., Must have passed the graduation examination with 50% or more marks., The maximum age limit will be 35 years for males and 40 years for females., The applicant or the applicant's parents should not have a government job., The applicant will not be able to do full time study, job / business etc. at other place during the training., The benefit of this scheme will be available to the applicant only once.
details.Starting Year of the Scheme: 2017-18: The organization should have more than three years of experience., The organization should have GST number / PAN card., Institutions should have biometric (fingerprint) machines for student attendance., For competitive recruitment examination, the faculty should have at least a bachelor's degree and general knowledge., The training institute should be registered under any one of the following Acts.

title: Professional courses training scheme for Scheduled Caste Boys and Girls.

details.Objective:: To train Scheduled Caste boys/girls under 3 months vocational training courses in the trades of Computer Jobwork, Telly-Accounting, Animation Graphics, Call Center Assistant, Mobile Repairing, Sales Executive in Shopping Malls etc., This Scheme shall be implemented through I.T.I., Mahatma Gandhi Labour Institute or other Government/semi-Government organizations., This scheme is being implemented through the Gujarat Knowledge Society (GKS), a Government of Gujarat organization which is established by Department of Technical Education, Gujarat State.

title: Financial Assistances to Scheduled Caste students for computer training.

details.Eligibility Criteria:: Income limit – Rs.50,000/-
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Stipend of Rs.250/- per month, for a period up to  6 months, Monthly Class Fee of Rs.200/- to the Training Institute per Trainee for six months.

title: Air Hostess, Travel and Hospitality Management courses for graduate Scheduled Caste candid

details.Eligibility Criteria:: Candidate must be Std.12 pass with proficiency in Hindi and English languages., Age – 18 to 23 years, Marital Status – Unmarried, Attractive personality, Height – (1) 162 c.m. for girls, (2) 172 c.m. for boys, Weight :  Proportionate to the height, Vision : Normal eye sight – 6/6 in one eye and 6/9 vision in another eye (without using spectacles or lense)
details.Pattern of Assistance:: The expenditure of Rs.1.25 lakh per trainee by the State Government., Entire expenditure of lodging, boarding and course-fee of trainee shall be borne by the State Government.

title: Stipend to Scheduled Caste students for IAS, IPS, IIM & ITC courses and allied services.

details.Scheme Name:BCK-38 Plan to provide incen: Must be a native of Gujarat State, Must be of Scheduled Caste., Must have completed undergraduate/postgraduate study.

In the year 2015-16, provision of Rs.2.05 crore has been made.

title: Gujarat Safai Kamdar Development Corporation, Gandhinagar.

details.Objectives:: Gujarat Safai Kamdar Development Corporation is constituted for rehabilitation of Sanitation Workers and their dependants., For implementation of schemes of resettlement of sanitation workers and their dependents.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: (Administrative Grant – Rs.50.00 lakhs)

title: Share capital for Safai Kamdar Development Corporation.
Financial Assistance to Small Entrepreneurs in Urban Areas.

details.Eligibility Criteria:: No Income limit, For purchasing place of business/shop
details.Pattern of Assistance :: Under the beneficiary bankable scheme, Rs. If you get a loan of up to Rs 10.00 lakh, then the annual beneficiary will be entitled to 4% interest, and the state government will pay interest of up to 4% for a maximum of 3 years. The current standard of subsidy is Rs.15,000 / -

title: Financial Assistance to Scheduled Caste Farmers for purchasing of agricultural land.

details.Eligibility Criteria:: Income limit – Rs.6.00 lakh per annum
details.Pattern of Assistance :: Up to 50% of total cost or maximum Rs.1.00 lakh per acre with ceiling of Rs.2.00 lakh limited to two acres.

title: BCK HS Sant Shri Ravidas Higher Skills Training Scheme SCW 11

details.Scheme Name: Sant Shri Ravidas High Skil: 1.Trainee must be of Scheduled Caste., 2.Income limit of Trainee’s family is 6 Lacs.

title: Free Medical Aid.

details.Eligibility Criteria:: Income limit Rural Area Rs.6,00,000/-, Income limit Urban Area Rs.6,00,000/-
details.Pattern of Assistance:: For common diseases - Rs.150/- per case., For serious delivery cases – Rs.500/- per case., For Tuberculosis – Rs.500/- per case., For Cancer disease – Rs.1000/- until the patient is cured., For Leprosy disease – Rs.800/- per month until the patient is cured., HIV-AIDS: Monthly Rs. 500 / - until the disease is gone

title: Maintenance and Development of Dr.Ambedkar Bhavan

details.Construction cost limit:: Buildings (Bhavans) have been constructed at Gandhinagar, Mehsana, Surat, Palanpur, Amreli, Patan, Surendranagar, Junagadh, Porbandar, Bhavnagar, Rajkot, Valsad and Jamnagar.

title: Addition/alterations in construction of Ambedkar Bhavan.
Financial Assistance for Housing on individual basis. (Dr.Ambedkar Avas Scheme)

details.Eligibility Criteria:: In the case of beneficiaries under Indira Awas Yojana and they are fulfilling other conditions of Dr. Ambedkar housing scheme, there is a provision to pay the assistance under this scheme., Income Limit Rs. 47,000 / -, Beneficiary should be either widow, handicapped, deserted woman, laborer; if there is any BPL, he should be given priority., Beneficiary should be of Scheduled Caste., Annual income of the beneficiary should not exceed Rs.68,000/-., The beneficiary should own and possess a plot or temporary dwelling erected with mud and soil., The plot area should be minimum 25 sq.mtrs., The beneficiary who does not include the beneficiary of the Indira Awas Yojana but fulfills the other conditions of the beneficiary, Dr. Ambedkar Awas Yojana, the beneficiary can be given benefit., The beneficiary who is not covered under the Indira Awas Yojana, but beneficiaries who fulfill other conditions of the beneficiary Dr. Ambedkar housing scheme, those who are widowed, working, handicapped, or extremely backward, can be given benefit.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Help. Rs. 45,000 / - for the urban area, Rs. 5000 / - for the beneficiary's work - Rs. 50,000 / - for flowering., The standard of assistance for rural area is Rs. 70,000 /

title: Financial Assistance for Housing in urban areas – (Dr.Ambedkar Avas Scheme)

details.Implement: Implementation through Gruh Nirman Board, Housing Board, Slum Clearance Board and others.

title: Financial Assistance for Housing to the most backward communities like Valmiki, Hadi, Nadiy

details.Eligibility Criteria:: If the beneficiaries are not able to benefit under the Indira Awas Yojana and they fulfill other conditions of the Dr. Ambedkar housing scheme, there is a provision to pay the assistance under this scheme., Income Limit Rs. 47,000 / -, Beneficiary should be either widow, handicapped, deserted woman, laborer; if there is any BPL, he should be given priority., Beneficiary should be of Scheduled Caste., Annual income of the beneficiary should not exceed Rs.68,000/-., The beneficiary should own and possess a plot or temporary dwelling erected with mud and soil which is not fit for inhabitation., The plot area should be minimum 25 sq.mtrs., No income limit for beneficiary of Most Backward Class.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Help. Rs. 45,000 / - for the urban area, Rs. 5000 / - for the beneficiary's work - Rs. 50,000 / - for flowering., The standard of assistance for rural area is Rs. 70,000 / -

title: Financial Assistance – Dr.Savita Ambedkar Inter-Caste Marriage encouragement Scheme.

details.Eligibility Criteria :: No income limit., Out of wedding couple, one person should belong to Scheduled Caste and the other should be Hindu upper caste.
details.Pattern of Assistance :: Rs.25,000/- cash towards household articles and saving certificates of Rs.25,000/-; in all financial assistance of Rs.50,000/-.

title: Financial Assistance for Kunvarbainu Mameru to Scheduled Caste girls.

details.Eligibility Criteria :: Income limit – Rs.68,000/- for urban areas and Rs.47,000/- for rural areas., Should have attained age fixed for marriage., More than two girls are given financial assistance., Under this scheme two girls of the Scheduled Caste family are given benefit.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: The beneficiary is paid the financial assistance of Rs. 10,000 / - for the girl.

title: Mai Ramabai Sat Fera Samuh Lagna Yojana.

details.Objective :: To prevent unnecessary expenses in society.
details.Eligibility criteria :: The persons below poverty line as per the norms fixed by the Rural Development in respect of Below Poverty Line, shall be entitled for benefit of this scheme., The couple availing benefit of this Scheme should have attained required age for marriage., Income limit – For rural areas – Rs.6,00,000/- and for urban areas- Rs.6,00,000/-.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Under this Scheme, Narmada Shree Nidhi Board shall be awarded as incentive for Rs.10,000/- shall be awarded to the couple getting married under the mass marriage program where minimum 10 couples get married., It has been resolved to pay cash assistance of Rs.2000/- per couple to the organization which organize Group Marriage Function for organizing the program., For organizing Group Marriage Functions with minimum 10 couples, the organizer will be paid incentive of Rs.2000/- per couple limited to maximum of Rs.50,000/-.

title: Social Education Camps.

details.Objective :: Social Education camps are being organized to disseminate information on the schemes implemented for the purpose of social and economic upliftment.

title: Nagrik Cell/Administration

details.Eligibility Criteria:: In cases of atrocities to the Scheduled Caste persons, financial assistance to victims and their dependents is being given who are victim of offences registered under provisions of the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989.
details.Pattern of Assistance :: In cases of atrocities to the Scheduled Caste persons, financial assistance to victims and their dependents is being given who are victim of offences registered under provisions of the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989, as per provisions of the Rules, 1995 framed under provisions of this Act., This Scheme is 50% centrally sponsored scheme.

title: Vir Meghmaya Contingency Plan under Protection of Civil Rights Act, 1955 and Prevention of

details.Eligibility Criteria:: For rehabilitation of the migrates (50% centrally sponsored scheme)
details.Pattern of Assistance:: The Contingency scheme is implemented for victims of the Scheduled Caste atrocities for their rehabilitation, which include assistance in cash or kind, allotment of agricultural land or plot for residential premises, rehabilitation fund, employment etc.

title: Research Unit for Scheduled Caste.

details.Pattern of Assistance :: Grant in aid is provided, whenever needed, for the Research Unit for Scheduled Castes functioning at the Gujarat Vidhyapeeth, Ahmedabad.

title: Satyavadi Raja Harishchandra Posthumous Assistance Scheme (Antyesthi Sahay).

details.Eligibility Criteria:: Income limit – Rs.6,00,000/-, The beneficiary-applicant shall, on death of his family member,  submit Death Certificate issued by Talati-cum-Mantri in case of rural areas and in case of urban areas, by Chief Officer of the Municipality.
details.Income Limit:: Rs. 47,000 / - per annum for rural area, Rs.68000 / - per annum for urban area
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Rs.5000/- as Financial Assistance at the time of death of member of a scheduled cast family to meet with requirement of Antyesthi expenses.

title: Nucleus Budget – Swami Tejanand Karmakand Training Scheme.

details.Eligibility Criteria:: Educated unemployed youth, Age limit of the applicant – between 18 and 45 years.
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Educated unemployed youth of Scheduled Caste are given Karmakand training without charging any fees.  At the end of training, he is provided with paraphernalia and instruments of Karmakand, free of cost., Outstation students provided free lodging and boarding facilities.

title: Staff for scheme of Protection of Civil Rights Act, 1955.

details.Objectives:: Staff for Head Office and District office for enforcement of Protection of Civil Rights Act.

title: Special Court for enforcement of SC and ST(Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989.

details.Pattern of Assistance :: For prompt disposal of atrocity cases.

title: Special Pracharak for Valmiki Welfare.

details.Objectives:: For propagating schemes of welfare of Valmiki Samaj.

title: Strengthening of Administrative machinery at all level.
Computerisation at all level with information and technology.
Strengthening of staff for Special Component Plan.

details.Objectives :: For administration of District offices under Scheduled Caste Special Component Plan., Staff for offices of the District Backward Class Welfare Officer and New District.

title: Purchase and hiring of vehicles.

details.Objectives:: Purchase, maintenance and hiring of vehicles for Head Office and District Offices.

title: Evaluation, Planning and monitoring Cell/Survey
State Scholarship to Pre-SSC Students (Poverty Alleviation Program)

details.Eligibility Criteria:: No income limit applicable., Government schools / private schools must pass in the next standard.

title: Subedar Ramji Grant-in-Aid to Backward class hostel (Poverty Alleviation Program)

details.Pattern of Assistance:: Total 592 hostels running – 425 Boys Hostels and 167 Girls Hostels., 13152 male and 5722 female inmates (Total 18,874), Annual maintenance expenditure is Rs.1,99,600/- per Hostel.

title: Interesting Loan Against Financial Loans To Buy Business / Business Locations for Small Bus

details.Eligibility Criteria:: Income limit – Rs.50,000/-, For purchasing site for business/shop
details.Pattern of Assistance:: Under the beneficiary bankable scheme, Rs. If you get a loan of up to 10.00 lakh, then the beneficiary will enjoy 4% interest annually and the interest subsidy of above 4% will be Rs. There is provision for a maximum of three years for a maximum of 15,000

title: Kumar Rajratan Bhimrao Ambedkar Vital Assistance Scheme (Poverty Alleviation Program)

details.Eligibility criteria: Rs.47,000/- for rural areas and, Rs.68,000/- for urban areas.
details.Income limit: Rs.150 / - per case for Vitiligo for females, Rs. 500 / - per case For severe maternal disease, Monthly Rs.500 / - for patients suffering from TB, until pain is passed., Monthly for cancer 1000 / - until the pain is complete, Monthly for leprosy 800 / - until the pain is complete, HIV-AIDS: Monthly Rs. 500 / - until the disease is gone

title: Rehabilitation of Scavengers and their dependents (Poverty Alleviation Program)

details.Objectives:: For rehabilitation of scavengers and their dependents.
details.Pattern of Assistance :: To advance loans to the scavengers for vocation-business for their rehabilitation with a view to engage them in other occupations.
